text: Cheilosia cynocephala is a Palearctic hoverfly. ==Description== A black Cheilosia with a bluish sheen, darkened wings and dark hairs. Van der Goot,V.S. Akad.Kiado, Budapest. ==Distribution and biology== It is found from Fennoscandia south to central France and England eastwards through Central Europe and on into central Russia.Southwards into the mountains of northern Italy and Yugoslavia.Fauna Europaea The habitat is open ground near rivers, streams or flushes in unimproved grassland, usually on calcareous soils, including montane pasture. where it flies from July–October. The larvae mine the stems of Carduus nutans. Adults visit white umbellifers, Calluna vulgaris., Cirsium arvense, Parnassia palustris, Pulicaria, Ranunculus, Salix repens, Saxifraga azoides, Scabiosa, Senecio Sonchus... ==References== ==External links== * Images representing Cheilosia cynocephala Category:Diptera of Europe Category:Hoverflies Category:Insects described in 1840
